title: WeWork co-Founder and CEO Adam Neumann is stepping down
text: WeWork co-Founder and Chief Executive Adam Naumann is resigning from that role and will remain nonexecutive chairman of the parent We Co., according to media reports and a statement placed on Twitter. Neuman's position as head of the company has become tenuous after the office-space sharing company was forced to delay its IPO earlier this month after concerns from some big investors about the company's huge losses and liabilities. In a statement issued on Twitter and attributed to the WeWork board, the company said Artie Minson, formerly co-president and chief financial officer, and Sebastian Gunningham, formerly vice chairman, have been named co-CEOs of the company, with immediate effect.
